thread.title: Man seriously injured after car rolls on Nelson highway | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: Man seriously injured after car rolls on Nelson highway | Stuff.co.nz

title: Man seriously injured after car rolls on Nelson highway | Stuff.co.nz
text:
Man seriously injured after car rolls on Nelson highway Last updated 14:01, February 5 2017 Marion van Dijk 
The car crashed off the Appleby Highway. This is a file photo of the area. 
A man was seriously injured after being flung from his car in a late night crash in Nelson. 
The man's car rolled on Appleby Highway near Appleby just before midnight on Saturday. 
The 33-year-old man was thrown from the car, which had landed in a paddock. 
He was taken to Nelson Hospital before being transferred by helicopter to Wellington Hospital's intensive care unit. 
The Fire Service used thermal imaging at the crash site to make sure no other people had been thrown from the car. 
The Serious Crash Unit attended the scene of the crash overnight and was investigating. 
Police were not looking for anybody else in relation to the incident.
